channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes and crumbling road surface, 17th February
item.description:
From bellegrove road onto shooter's hill there are lots of potholes and the road surface is breaking up especially as you approach the brow of the hill going towards the old police station.it is getting so bad there is no way to avoid the potholes unless you drive on the extreme left of the lane putting cyclists at risk and possibly damaging your vehicle from the foliage on the left.as this has been reported several times i assume we will be able to claim when our vehicles are damaged.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bellegrove Road, Welling
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins x 2 on repeat, 17th February
item.description:
This is a repeat issue. The 2 x bins by the benches on Highbridges Wharf are overflowing. There is broken glass on the ground by one of them. I repeat my plea made several times before and not responded to: can the council empty these bins more frequently, and particularly on a Monday as the weekend generates a lot of this. Although it’s now Tuesday and still not dealt with …

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Highbridge Wharf, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes (one large) in City Road (by Peerless Street junction), 17th February
item.description:
These are the two worst ones on the Northern carriageway of City Road (just north of the junction with Peerless Street) Gravel is pinging from the car wheels across the pavement. This pavement is used by as the primary pedestrian route from Old Street to Moorfields Eye Hospital by both patients and staff. Several other potholes are emerging to the South, and one more to the North.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 152-160, City Road, Finsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
There is a hole in the road just next to the pavement/drive way of 16 Lansdowne road. The hole appears to be over a sewerage pipe and is emitting a smell of sewerage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdowne Road, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Four Tree roots broken through paving on Waterway Link, 17th February
item.description:
Four Tree roots have erupted through the footpath on Waterway Link between Kagley Bridge Road and Lennard Road. The roots raise up the path by over 10cm/3 inches They are a trip hazard, make it very difficult for buggies and wheelchairs/mobility scooters to pass over. What three words location ///cult.excuse.answer On the footpath Behind Harris Academy on BR3 1QN

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pavilion Lane, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged/leaning bus stop, 17th February
item.description:
Damaged bus stop has been like this (see photo) for about 5 or 6 weeks. When is it due to be replaced? Reported via mobile in the Damage - bus stop leaning category anonymously at 12:05 today and sent to TfL less than a minute later. TfL ref: FMS8938571. TfL reported back as follows: "Your report has been investigated by our team and this is not the responsibility of Transport for London. However, your local borough will be able to help you" ....so over to you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branch preventing maintenance on telephone line, 17th February
item.description:
The overhead telephone line to 48 Lynwood Grove is caught on a a relatively small branch of the tree between 46 and 48 Lynwood Grove. The fibre line was installed in 2023. It has always had slack due to Openreach installing without first pruning the trees, but it has worsened after a neighbour's oak was pruned. It is particularly clear in the winter after the trees have all lost their leaves. I am now trying to get the line re-tensioned by Openreach. On their site visit, they advised that they are not able to do so without the branch being pruned and that they are not allowed to do this on a public tree. And apparently a fibre cable can't simply be swung over as it would risk damaging the cable. The branch is also preventing me from having a new line from one of the altnets installed. Please could this branch be pruned back to release this overhead line? I can then get it re-tensioned and made well clear of the highway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynwood Grove, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
